DefaultValue: My Valheim Server - Powered by AMP
Description: Server name as it appears in the server list
Name of the world .db file to load. Also used as the random seed used for terrain random generation
Password that clients must supply in order to connect. NOTE: Minimum password length is 5 characters & Password can't be in the server name. Default Password: 12345
Whether or not the server appears on the server list. Disable for a LAN-only server.

When enabled, the backend will be running Playfab instead of Steamworks. A "Join code" will appear when you join a Dedicated server supporting crossplay. Players can use this code to join the server. This Join code is regenerated whenever the server is restarted.
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are in-game admins. [Find your Steam64 ID](https://steamidfinder.com/)
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are permitted in-game. [Find your Steam64 ID](https://steamidfinder.com/)
Sets the world modifiers preset, which applies each modifier according to preconfigured levels. The preset can be overriden by custom modifier settings.
Governs how much damage you give and take. Also governs how likely you are to encounter higher leveled enemies, and how dangerous they are.
Governs what happens when you die. From not dropping equipment and items, and heavily reduced skill loss, to permanent loss of equipment and skills.
Governs the amount of resources you gain from the world and from enemies.
Governs how often enemies may raid your base.
Changes how portals work in the game. From bringing all items through portal, to no portals at all.
If set, build pieces require no materials to build. You still need to discover recipes as per usual.
If enabled, enemies won't attack until you provoke them.

If enabled, raids are based on the progress of each individual player, rather than on which bosses have been killed on the server. Recommended if you want the game to be slightly friendlier to players with different progress.
If set, you will not have access to the map or the minimap. This makes the game harder than intended, by requiring navigation by the stars and world tree.
A list of Steam64 IDs for players that are banned [Find a Steam64 ID](https://steamidfinder.com/)
Changes how often the world is saved in seconds. Default is 1800 seconds (30 minutes).
"public" is default. Choose a custom release on [SteamDB](https://steamdb.info/app/896660/depots/). NOTE: Update the server after changing release streams.
Installs BepInEx. Standalone - DO NOT use with the Install Valheim Plus option. You must also select the "BepInEx Version" in the next field. NOTE: Update the server after enabling this option.

The version of BepInEx to download. You can find the latest version on [Thunderstore.io](https://thunderstore.io/c/valheim/p/denikson/BepInExPack_Valheim/). NOTE: Update the server after editing this option.
Installs Valheim Plus. Includes BepInEx. NOTE: Update the server after enabling this option.
The settings on this page are split up into sections. The start of a section will be labeled with "sectionName Enable" the setting in-between are only modifiable if that section is enabled.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.

Enable sleeping without setting bed as spawn. When hovering over a bed you will be presented with a Hot-Key 'LShift+E'. This Hot-Key will allow for you to sleep on any bed without having to set a spawn-point.
Enable sleeping on only unclaimed beds without setting bed as spawn. This option enabled only beds that are not claimed by other players can be slept on without setting spawn-point using 'Shift+E'
DisplayName: Enable Sleeping On Unclaimed Beds Only

Description: Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Configure the speed at which the bees produce honey in seconds, 1200 seconds are 24 ingame hours.
Configure the maximum amount of honey in beehives.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest chests.
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit feature. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50
Display the minutes and seconds until the beehive produces honey on crosshair hover.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Remove some of the Invalid placement messages, most notably provides the ability to place objects into other objects
Removes the "Mystical forces" building prevention and allows destruction of build objects in those areas with the hammer.
DisplayName: Disable Mystical Forces Prevent Placement Message

Description: Removes the weather damage from rain and water erosion.
The maximum range in meters that you can place build objects at inside the hammer build mode.
The radius, in meters, in which a piece must be to contribute to the comfort level.
When destroying a building piece, it always drops full resources. We recommend to enable this if you use this section.
When destroying a building piece, it always drops pieces that the devs have marked as "do not drop". We recommend to enable this if you use this section.
DisplayName: Always Drop "Do Not Drop" Marked Resources

Description: Enabling this will cause repairing with the hammer to repair in a radius instead of a single piece.
Sets the area repair radius of enableAreaRepair. A value of 7.5 would mean your repair radius is 7.5 meters. Requires "Enable Auto Repair"
This feature allows you to craft from nearby chests when in range. Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Disable this feature when using a Cooking Station.
If in a workbench area, uses it as reference point when scanning for chests.
This option prevents crafting to pull items from warded areas if the player doesn't have access to it.
DisplayName: Craft From Chest Ignore Private Area Check

Description: The range of the chest detection in meters.
The interval in seconds that the feature scans your nearby chests.
Allows the system to use and see contents of carts for crafting. Might also allow use of other modded containers or vehicles not accessible otherwise.
Allows the system to use and see contents of ships for crafting. Might also allow use of other modded containers or vehicles not accessible otherwise.
Modifiers are increases and reduction in percent declared by 50, or -50. Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
The Durability of armor. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of axes. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of bows. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of cultivator. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of hammer. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of hoe. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of pickaxes. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of shields. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of torch. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
The Durability of weapons. The value 50 will increase the durability from 100 to 150. The value -50 will reduce the durability from 100 to 50.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Configure the time that the fermenter takes to produce its product, 2400 seconds are 48 ingame hours.
Configure the total amount of produced items from a fermenter.
Display the minutes and seconds until the fermenter is done on crosshair hover.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
Automatically pull meads from nearby chests to be placed inside the Fermenter as soon as its empty.
This option prevents the fermenter to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this be enabled
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Maximum is 50
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Enabling this torch-type fire sources will stay at max fuel level once filled. Applies to: wood torches, iron torches, green torches, sconces and brazier.
Enabling this non torch-type fire sources will stay at max fuel level once filled.
Automatically pull wood from nearby chests to be placed inside the Fire as soon as its empty.
This option prevents the Fire to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this to be enabled
DisplayName: Fire Source Ignore Private Area Check

Description: The range of the chest detection for the auto fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of ore in a Furnace.
Maximum amount of coal in a Furnace.
The total amount of coal used to produce a single smelted ingot.
The time it takes for the Furnace to produce a single ingot in seconds.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
The Furnace will pull coal and raw materials from nearby chests to be automatically added to it when its empty.
This option prevents the Furnace to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this to be enabled
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50
This option allows all ores inside the Furnace.
Modifiers are increases and reduction in percent declared by 50, or -50. Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.

Modify the chance to drop resources from resource nodes affected by this category. This only works on resource nodes that do not have guaranteed drops. As example by default scrap piles in dungeons have a 20% chance to drop a item, if you set this option to 200, you will then have a 60% chance to drop iron.
Drop chance for chitin. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for copper ore. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for core wood. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for elder bark. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for fine wood. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for iron scrap. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for silver ore. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for stone. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for tin ore. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Drop chance for wood. The value 50 will increase the dropped wood from trees from 10 to 15. The value -50 will reduce the amount of dropped wood from 10 to 5.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Player inventory number of rows (inventory is resized up to 6 rows, higher values will add a scrollbar). Default 4, Minimum 4, Maximum 20
Wood chest number of columns. Default 5, Minimum 3, Maximum 8
Wood chest number of rows, more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 2, Minimum 2, Maximum 10
Personal chest number of columns. Default 3, Minimum 3, Maximum 8
Personal chest number of rows. Default 2, Minimum 2, Maximum 20
Iron chest number of columns. Default 6, Minimum 3, Maximum 8
Iron chest number of rows,more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 4, Minimum 3, Maximum 20
Blackmetal chests already have 8 columns by default but now you can lower it. Default 8, Minimum 3, Maximum 8
Blackmetal number of rows, more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 4, Minimum 3, Maximum 20
Cart inventory number of columns. Default 8, Minimum 6, Maximum 8
Cart inventory number of rows, more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 3, Minimum 3, Maximum 30
Karve inventory number of columns. Default 2, Minimum 2, Maximum 8
Karve inventory number of rows, more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 2, Minimum 2, Maximum 30
Longboat inventory number of columns. Default 8, Minimum 6, Maximum 8
Longboat inventory number of rows, more than 4 rows will add a scrollbar. Default 3, Minimum 3, Maximum 30
By default tools and weapons go into inventories top to bottom and other materials bottom to top. Enable to make all items go into the inventory top to bottom.
By default items go to their original position when picking up your tombstone. Enable to make all stacks try to merge with an existing stack first.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Enables you to teleport with ores and other usually teleport restricted objects
Increase or reduce item weight by a modifier in percent. The value -50 will reduce item weight of every object by 50%, 50 will increase the weight of every item by 50%.

Increase or reduce the size of all maximum item stacks by a modifier in percent. The value 50 would set a usual item stack of 100 to be 150. The value -50 would set a usual item stack of 100 to be 50.
Set duration that dropped items stay on the ground before they are despawning. Game default is 3600 seconds.
Items dropped always float in water.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of wood in a Kiln.
Enabling to disable Fine Wood processing.
Enabling to disabled Round Log processing.
The time it takes for the Kiln to produce a single piece of coal in seconds.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
The Kiln will pull wood from nearby chests to be automatically added to it when its empty. his option respects the Process Fine Wood and Process Round Log settings.
Stops Auto Fuel looking for fuel when there is at least this quantity of Coal in nearby chests
DisplayName: Kiln Stop Auto Fuel If X Coal In Chests

Description: This option prevents the Kiln to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. or convenience, we recommend this to be enabled.
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50

Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section. Each value below (in percent) will modify the yield when "picking" items (default key E) such as berries and flowers. A value of 100 will double drops, 200 will triple and so on.
All berries, all mushrooms, onions and carrots. A value of 100 will double drops, 200 will triple and so on.
Barley, Flax, Dandelion, Thistle, Carrot Seeds, Turnip Seeds, Turnip, Onion Seeds. A value of 100 will double drops, 200 will triple and so on.
Bone Fragments, Flint, Stone, Wood (branches on the ground).
Amber, Amber Pearl, Coins, Ruby.
Surtling Core only.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of ore in a Smelter.
Maximum amount of coal in a Smelter.
Maximum amount of coal in a Smelter.
The time it takes for the Smelter to produce a single ingot in seconds.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
The Smelter will pull coal and raw materials from nearby chests to be automatically added to it when its empty.
This option prevents the Smelter to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. or convenience, we recommend this to be enabled
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of flax in a spinning wheel.
The time it takes for the spinning wheel to produce linen thread in seconds.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
The Spinning Wheel will pull flax from nearby chests to be automatically added to it when its empty.
his option prevents the Spinning Wheel to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this to be enabled.
DisplayName: Spinning Wheel Ignore Private Area Check

Description: The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Modify what happens when a tamed creature is attacked. Normal - default, Essential - Deadly attacks stun instead of kill, tamed creatures can still die rarely, Immortal - Can't Die.

This will circumvent the mortality setting, so even if tamed creatures are immortal, players can still kill them with a butcher knife. For this option to work you need to have mortality to set to either essential or immortal.
How long it takes for a tamed creature to recover if mortality is set to essential and they are stunned.
If the tamed creature is recovering from a stun, then add Stunned to the hover text on mouse over.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Change the base wagon physical mass of the wagon object. This is essentially the base weight of a cart.
This value changes the physical weight of wagons by +/- more/less from item weight inside. The value 50 would increase the weight by 50% more. The value -100 would remove the entire extra weight.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of barley in a windmill.
The time it takes for the windmill to produce a single ingot in seconds.
Ignore wind intensity so it always takes the production speed value to process one barley.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside the nearest nearby chests.
The Windmill will pull barley from nearby chests to be automatically added to it when its empty.
This option prevents the Windmill to pull items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this to be enabled
The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Default 10, Minimum 0, Maximum is 50 meters
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Set the workbench radius in meters.
Set the enemy spawn radius around workbenches in meters. This value equals Workbench Range if its set to 0.
Sets the workbench attachment radius. e.g. anvil
Disables the roof and exposure requirement to use a workbench.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Maximum amount of sap in an Eitr Refinery.
Maximum amount of soft tissue in an Eitr Refinery.
The time it takes for the Eitr Refinery to produce a single Eitr.
The Eitr Refinery will pull sap and soft tissue from nearby chests automatically when it's empty.
Instead of dropping the items, they will be placed inside nearby chests.
This option prevents the Eitr Refinery from pulling items from warded areas if it isn't placed inside of it. For convenience, we recommend this to be set to true.
DisplayName: Eitr Refinery Ignore private Area Check

Description: The range of the chest detection for the auto deposit and auto fuel features. Default 5 (0 - 50).
The settings on this page are split up into sections. The start of a section will be labeled with "sectionName Enable" the setting in-between are only modifiable if that section is enabled.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
The value 50 will increase the armor by 7. The value -50 will reduce the armor 7.
The value 50 will increase the armor by 7. The value -50 will reduce the armor 7.
The value 50 will increase the armor by 7. The value -50 will reduce the armor 7.
The value 50 will increase the armor by 7. The value -50 will reduce the armor 7.

The modifier value for the experience gained of axes.
The modifier value for the experience gained of blocking.
The modifier value for the experience gained of bows.
The modifier value for the experience gained of clubs.
The modifier value for the experience gained of fire magic.
The modifier value for the experience gained of frost magic.
The modifier value for the experience gained of jump.
The modifier value for the experience gained of knives.

The modifier value for the experience gained of polearms.

The modifier value for the experience gained of sneak.

The modifier value for the experience gained of unarmed.

Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Hotkey to enable First Person. Default F10
Default Field Of View to use. Default 65.0
Hotkey to raise Field Of View. Default PageUp
Hotkey to raise Field Of View. Default PageDown
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Increase or reduce the time that food lasts by %. The value 50 would cause food to run out 50% slower, -50% would cause the food to run out 50% faster.
This option prevents food degrading over time - in other words, it retains its maximum benefit until it runs out instead of reducing its effect over time.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
The base amount of carry weight of your character.
Increase the buff you receive to your carry weight from Megingjord's girdle.
Increase auto pickup range of all items.
Disable all types of camera shake.
The base unarmed damage multiplied by your skill level. 120 will result in a maximum of up to 12 damage when you have a skill level of 10. Default 70
When enabled, you will not be permitted to place a crop within the grow radius of another crop.
How many seconds each comfort level contributes to the rested bonus.
Change the death penalty in percentage, where higher will increase the death penalty and lower will reduce it. This is a modifier value. 50 will increase it by 50%, -50 will reduce it by 50%.
If enabled, this option will automatically repair your equipment when you interact with the appropriate workbench.
Boss buff duration (seconds). Default 300 seconds
Boss buff cooldown (seconds). Default 1200 seconds
Disable the Guardian Buff animation
If enabled, when equipping a one-handed weapon, the best shield from your inventory is automatically equipped. (Best is determined by highest block power)
When unequipping a one-handed weapon also unequip shield from inventory.
If enabled, weapon switches requested mid-attack will be carried out when the current attack is finished instead of being ignored.
If enabled, you will always skip the intro of the game.
If disabled, disables the "I have arrived!" message on player spawn.
If enabled, you will not put away / unequip your items when swimming.
If enabled, items will be re-equipped when you exit water after swimming (if they were hidden automatically)

This value represents how much the fall damage should be scaled in +/- %. This is a modifier value. The value 50 would result in 50% increased fall damage. The value -50 would result in 50% reduced fall damage.
Max fall damage. Game default is 100 (so with enough health, falls can't kill).
If enabled, all tutorials will skip from now on. You can turn this config off and reset the tutorial (in the settings) at any time.
Disable the encumbered state when you carry too many items (overweight)
Allow auto pickup of items when encumbered (overweight)
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Increase or decrease the block value on all shields in %. -50 would be 50% less block rating, 50 would be 50% more block rating.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Changes the amount of stamina cost of using the dodge roll by %
Changes the stamina drain of being overweight by %
Changes the stamina cost of jumping by %
Changes the stamina cost of running by %
Changes the stamina cost of sneaking by %
Changes the total amount of stamina recovered per second by %
Changes the delay until stamina regeneration sets in by %
Changes the stamina drain of swimming by %

The settings on this page are split up into sections. The start of a section will be labeled with "sectionName Enable" the setting in-between are only modifiable if that section is enabled.

Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section. This does NOT install Valheim Plus. To install Valheim Plus, navigate to "SteamCMD and Updates" and enable Install Valheim Plus, then update the server.
Display the Valheim Plus logo in the main menu
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section. Recommended to be left on.
Maximum Concurrent Players on the server.
Removes the requirement to have a server password.
This settings add a version control check to make sure that people that try to join your server has Valheim Plus installed. Recommended to leave on.
Sync config to clients. Recommended to leave on.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Default is 4% monster damage increase per player in radius.
Default is 40% monster health increase per player in radius.
Adds additional players to the difficulty calculation in multiplayer unrelated to the actual amount. This option is disabled if its set to 0.
Sets the nearby player count always to this value + Extra Player Count Nearby. This option is disabled if its set to 0.
The range in meters at which other players count towards nearby players for the difficulty scale
If you set this to enabled, all portals will be disabled.
If you set this to enabled, portal names will be displayed in big text in center of screen.
If you set this to enabled the console will be force disabled in-game.
If you set this to enabled this will remove dense fog from the game.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Change time formatting from 24hr to AM-PM.
Sets the font size of time text.
Sets how red the time text is (51/255).
Sets how green the time text is (51/255).
Sets how Blue the time text is (51/255).
Sets how Transparent the time text is (51/255).
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Changes how bright it looks at night. A value between 5 and 10 will result in nearly double in brightness at night.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
The maximum zoom distance to your character in-game.
The maximum zoom distance to your character when in a boat.
Adjusts the camera FOV. The in-game camera FOV default is 65
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
If the player is outside of this range in meters in comparison to the creator of the shout you will not see the message on the map or in the chat. If this is set to 0, its disabled.
With this option enabled you will see the shout message in your chat window even if you are outside of Shout Distance
If the player is outside of this range in meters in comparison to the creator of the ping on the map you will not see the ping on the map. If this is set to 0, its disabled.
Disable the forced upper and lower case conversions for in-game text messages of all types.
This determines the range in meters that you can see whisper text messages by default.
This determines the range in meters that you can see normal text messages by default.
This determines the range in meters that you can see shout text messages by default.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Enter the advanced building mode with this key when building. Default F1
Exit the advanced building mode with this key when building. Default F3
Copy the object rotation of the currently selected object in Advanced Building Mode. Default Keypad7
Copy the object rotation of the currently selected object in Advanced Building Mode. Default Keypad8
Increases the amount an object rotates and moves. Holding Shift will increase in increments of 10 instead of 1. Default KeypadPlus
Decrease the amount an object rotates and moves. Holding Shift will increase in increments of 10 instead of 1. Default KeypadMinus
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Enter the advanced editing mode with this key. Default Keypad0
Reset the advanced editing mode with this key. Default F7
Exit the advanced editing mode with this key. Default F8
Confirm the placement of the object and place it. Default KeypadEnter
Copy the object rotation of the currently selected object in Advanced Editing Mode. Default Keypad7
Apply the copied object rotation of the currently selected object in Advanced Editing Mode. Default Keypad8
Increases the amount an object rotates and moves. Holding Shift will increase in increments of 10 instead of 1. Default KeypadPlus
Decreases the amount an object rotates and moves. Holding Shift will increase in increments of 10 instead of 1. Default KeypadMinus
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Key to enable grid alignment. Default LeftAlt
Key to toggle grid alignment. Default F7
Key to change the default alignment. Default F6
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Rotates placement marker by 1 degree on the Y axis, Can still attach to nearly pieces. Default LeftAlt
Rotates placement marker by 1 degree on the X axis, Can still attach to nearly pieces. Default C
Rotates placement marker by 1 degree on the Z axis, Can still attach to nearly pieces. Default V
Copy rotation of placement marker from target piece in front of you. Default F
Set rotation to be perpendicular to piece in front of you. Default G
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Roll forwards on hot key pressed. Default F9
Roll backwards on hot key pressed. Default F10
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Shows the required amount of items AND the amount of items in your inventory in build mode and while crafting. This is enabled when the CraftFromChest section is enabled.
Shows small notifications about all skill experience gained in the top left corner.
Removes the red screen flash overlay when the player takes damage.
If bow is in hotbar, display current ammo & total ammo under hotbar icon
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.

With this enabled you will receive the same exploration progression as other players on the server. This will also enable the option for the server to sync everyone's exploration progression on connecting to the server.
The radius of the map that you explore when moving.
Prevents you and other people on the server to turn off their map sharing option.
This option automatically shares created pins with everyone playing on the server.
Display carts and boats on the map.
DisplayName: Show Carts and Boats on Map

Description: Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Value of 10 would increase the projectile velocity from 50 to 55.
Value of (+)10 increase in accuracy will change the variance of projectile 1 degree to 0.9 degree at the point of projectile release.
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Value of 50 would increase the minimum charge velocity from 2 to 3.
Value of 50 would increase the maximum charge velocity (of Finwood bow) from 50 to 75.
Value of (+)50 increase in accuracy will change the variance of arrows 20 degree to 10 degree at the point of minimum charge release.
Value of (+)50 increase in accuracy will change the variance of arrows 1 degree to 0.5 degree at the point of maximum charge release.
Enabling this option will linearly scale by skill level from the base values of the weapon to the modified values (according to multipliers).
Enabling this section gives you access to the settings up to the next section.
Disables the entire structural integrity system and allows for placement in free air, does not prevent building damage.
Disables any damage from anything to all player built structures. Does not prevent damage from structural integrity.
Disables any damage from anything to all player built boats.
Disables water force damage to all player built boats.
DisplayName: Disable Water Force Damage to Player Boats

Description: Reduces the loss of structural integrity by distance in % less. The value 100 would result in disabled structural integrity over distance, does not allow for placement in free air without Disable Structural Integrity.

The range of wards by meters. Default value 20
